@vidyarathne 

I agree with you. This is NOT Windows 8, it's a misguided attempt to glorify Windows 7.

Remove the Ribbon? 
It's no longer Windows 8, it's now Windows 8 Retarded.

Why not just leave the option to minimize the ribbon untouched. Why are you de-evolving?

There are some really user-friendly tweaks, like the right-click Shell option to Power; Shutdown, Restart, Lock, etc..

But removing the Ribbon is not progress, it is regression, denying technology.  It would have been nice if Nishant had left the option to minimize it intact instead.

Otherwise, I am sure that this is a very well done Tweaked version of Micrsoft Software. For now, I think I'll stick with Microsoft's Version of Their Operating System, thanks.
